Reviews.Title: Got a defective unit
Reviews.Author: Eric M. Yoshimitsu
Reviews.Content: We purchased this unit based upon Eastman Kodak's reputation for ease of use and photo quality. This was to be a replacement unit for my Z730. The latter being too big and bulky for my current needs. Based on previous experience with Kodak, I decided to give the M381 a try. Being familiar with the Kodak interface from my previous camera, I felt confident that I could pick up the new camera and get excellent photos immediately without needing to suffer a learning curve.Features I liked: Small size, big LCD screen, familiar menu / user-interface, battery in-camera recharging.What I didn't like: Photo / Video quality.We took our new M381 out for a test drive at Disneyland today; unfortunately nearly all of the photos we took were overexposed, grainy, or completely washed out. Even the best photos had broad pixelated stripes through the photos. The videos were grainy and overexposed as well; fortunately not as badly.  Our trip today was for my wife's birthday; unfortunately none of the photos we took on this trip are useable. While I do like the simplicity of the operation of Kodak products, I cannot endorse this particular unit. While your experience may (hopefully) be better than ours, my confidence in Kodak's quality control has been devastated.I can't comment on battery life as we were not going to keep it long enough to find out. We aren't planning on taking enough photos or videos to kill the battery; we'll be returning it as soon as possible. While it might be worthwhile to return it to get a new unit of the same model, I'm no longer confident the quality control measures are in place at the manufacturer. I can ill-afford to miss more memorable moments to defective cameras.I might someday return to Kodak products, but not for some time.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Christian J. Ingebretsen
Reviews.Content: When looking for a digital camera this seemed like the best camera for the least money.  With 5x zoom and 12mp, it's a pretty good camera.  Unfortunately, I have to agree with the other reviewer that Kodak's quality control is lacking.  The main reason we like the Kodak EZShare cameras is the "Blur Reduction" feature.  With a 2 year old and 4 year old, this feature is a must.  We purchased one M381, and the feature did not work.  Using it, the pictures were less in focus than when we used the normal mode.  We returned it for a replacement, and have been very happy with the replacement.  We have not experienced the grainy pictures the other reviewer mentioned, and are happy with the replacement.

Reviews.Title: Bad, Fuzzy, Out of FOUCUS
Reviews.Author: LiSam
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera at a Pre-Thanksgiving Sale and was so excited to use it. Well I got home, took everything out of the box and started to shoot my two little girls. Well I was noticing that everything was blurry. So I changed the camera to blurr reduction and it was still bad. I have now had this camera for 2 weeks, and I have decided that I will be taking it back. This was the worst money every spent. My 5 megapixel took better pix than this! Very disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Andrew F. Charles
Reviews.Content: This is a camera which balances quality against price form kodak thus far and had no problems with it.

Reviews.Title: Easy To Use Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: Big Tom
Reviews.Content: This is a very easy to use compact camera.  Good photo quaility.  I also really like the the AC battery charger, allows me to keep the camera charged while traveling.  With memory card holds over 1,000 photos!

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!!!
Reviews.Author: C J  Hunt
Reviews.Content: I love my Kodak M381 Digital Camera (Grey/Blue). I got it for Christmas. I've taken many pictures and they turned out so good! I've also taken several videos and they are very good! I didn't notice any little sounds while taking the videos. It's amazing the things this camera will do. Most cameras only have 1 setting for the flash. The Kodak M381 has four settings. I love this and it works very well. I was using my camera for 3 days and didn't have to recharge the batteries once. I still had plenty of charge left.I also like the size of the camera. It fits in my hand nicely and the menu button and the other functions buttons are easy to use. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone! You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Just say NO!
Reviews.Author: Nickie L. Parrish "Parrini1"
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use, light & portable.However, the picture quality is seriously lacking!The shutter time is extremely slow, and even when you take the time to be sure the face recognition box is in focus, the picture is still very grainy & blurry. Ultimately...  I returned this item.Are you absolutely sure this camera is a Kodak?

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed in Kodak right now
Reviews.Author: Shannon Silva "happy mom"
Reviews.Content: I was always a big fan of Kodak until we purchased this camera. I have a 2 year old son and need something that will keep up with his quick moves. After a week of using this camera, I decided to return it. More than half of the pictures we took were incredibly grainy and blurry. Some were excellent, but I don't want a camera that gives me good pictures only half the time. I returned it today and purchased the Canon 1200IS and am so happy with it. For $20 more, it seems like a much better camera. The Kodak was a 12 mp and the Canon is a 10 with a smaller screen, but I still can't say enough good things about it. Hopefully Kodak will up it's quality control in the future!

Reviews.Title: GREAT BUT
Reviews.Author: SHER
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THE CAMERA THE PICS ARE CRYSTAL CLEAR THE MOVIE MODE IS  GREAT THE ONLY SUCKY THING IS THE VOLUME ON IT. NOW IDK IF THTS HOW IT IS FOR ALL DIGITAL CAMERA'S BUT I WISH IT WAS LOUDER... BUT OTHER THEN THT THE CAMERA IS GREAT THE SCREEN IS VERY BIG I LOVE THT..ANOTHER THING THE CAMERA IS NICE AND LIGHT IT COULD FIT RIGHT INTO YOUR POCKETS.. BUT ME I PLAN ON PURCHASING A CASE FOR MY CAMERA SO SHOULD IT FALL IT WONT HAVE DAMAGES DUE2THE CAMERA BEING SO LIGHT...

Reviews.Title: NEVER BUY THIS CAMERA
Reviews.Author: galantgarage
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the worst digital camera you will ever buy....went from an Kodak Easyshare 4530 with only 5.0 mp to this suppossedly better M381 with 12 mp and hate myself for doing so.  The first camera with lower megapixels took far better shots...unfortunately I got it wet on Splash Mountain at Disneyworld and had to get a new one.  Happy with Kodak I decided to upgrade to higher MP thinking I would get even better shots...NO!!!...not with this piece of crap camera....2/3 of all of the pictures you take with this thing are way out of focus and come out horrible.  You'd think with the extremely long time the camera takes to focus that the picture would be perfect but alas, this is not so...I get worse pictures with this camera than I did back in the days of my polaroid.  Kodak, please take this crap off the market and promptly issue refunds to all of those people duped into purchasing your garabage.

Reviews.Title: Not a good camera
Reviews.Author: Latha Rangarajan
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera 15 months back, worked well for sometime. Have never dropped the camera but when you use the zoom feature the camera shuts off. Battery dies very quickly. I have not been able to figure out why the camera lens has been out, can never shut it off, it is stuck. Please do not buy this camera, even if you get it for a good deal.

Reviews.Title: NO GOOD
Reviews.Author: IVYBEAN
Reviews.Content: I HAVE ALWAYS BOUGHT KODAK BRANDS AND NEVER HAD PROBLEMS UNTIL I BOUGHT THIS CAMRA. IT STARTED OUT FINE BUT WITHIN A MONTH I STARTED HAVING PROBLEMS, THE PICTURES WERE COMING OUT BLURRY, GRAINY AND SOMETIMES ONLY HALF OF A PICTURE CAME OUT. THE PICS WERE NO GOOD. ALSO WHEN YOU USE THE ZOOM FEATURE THE CAMRA JUST SHUTS OFF. DO NOT BUY THIS CAMRA. I AM VERY DISSAPOINTED WITH KODAK PRODUCTS!

Reviews.Title: Don't buy
Reviews.Author: T. Greenwood "Tom"
Reviews.Content: This camera has a difficult time focusing... it simply doesn't. One picture in ten is actually in focus and sure it's a sharp picture, I can't deal with the ratio.The video zoom is choppy, so don't do it.I got rid of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: P. Vandenbroek
Reviews.Content: I was given the Kodak Easyshare M381 as a gift. All the pictures are grainy and terrible! I thought it was a setting which needed to be changed, but after checking into that possibility, we found all the settings to be accurate. I will be taking the camera back to the store to replace it--but definitely not with another Kodak camera!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for guys.
Reviews.Author: O. Bonds
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my boyfriend for Christmas and he loves it. It's a perfect size for him and he can carry it in his pocket. The pictures are great too.

Reviews.Title: M381 KODAK CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Eugene Priebe
Reviews.Content: I AM VERY PLEASED WITH THE DELIVERY, PRICE AND CONDITION OF CAMERA.IT WAS WELL WORTH PURCHASING THRU AMAZON. THANK YOU... GENE PRIEBE

Reviews.Title: Blurry Pictures
Reviews.Author: P. Davis
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace two older Kodak cameras that took excellent pictures.  On average 75 - 80% of pictures taken are blurry.  The camera has been sent to the factory recommended repair service twice with no improvement made to picture quality.  As Kodak will not will not allow me to return/exchange the camera, I'm shopping for a non-Kodak replacement.

Reviews.Title: Everything is great so far
Reviews.Author: M. Scott
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera today and played around with it for about an hour and it seems great. I will update this review after I spend more time using it. But here are some thoughts of the things I have read about in other reviews.1st some reviewers have complained about noise while the camera is focusing. It is not that loud but it did make noise that I guess could be a clicking sound. So I checked out my older Kodak and it made the same noise. The older camera is about 5 years old and has been dropped several times. As far as I can tell this is just the sound of the motor that controls the auto focus and appears to be a normal.2nd is the dial on top. Some felt that it was cheap and could break easy or did break. My old camera had a larger dial but feels the same. Again no problem with that one. This is an electronic device and should be handled with care. If you need a tougher camera they make ones for that application.Other than that this camera seems great so far. More to come though.

Reviews.Title: No Thanks
Reviews.Author: Jeff C.
Reviews.Content: Like the first reviewer, I have been a professional for more than 30 years. I have seen point-and-shoot technology skyrocket in recent years, and have personally shot images with my previous Kodak digital that rivaled those from my expensive digital SLR. I decided to purchase the M381 to use for shooting a client event. Since the event included a rock concert, I did not want to lug around an SLR that probably would not be approved for use in an arena. Of the more than 200 images I shot, perhaps 25 are useable. On the beautiful 3" LCD, they looked fine when shot. Once offloaded however, they were extremely grainy, and most were too blurred to use. I should be clear that these were images of attendees, not the concert itself, and included many shot at a pre-concert venue that was well-lit. To be fair, a few were stunningly clear and sharp, but shots before and after, with the same settings were terrible.I have always been happy with Kodak products, and after spending huge sums of money over the years on their film, darkroom paper and chemicals, I have a sentimental interest in seeing Kodak succeed in the digital arena. But this camera performed quite poorly in my opinion. Although this item is priced attractively, I cannot afford to try a replacement. I need equipment to perform out of the box. I may try a more expensive Kodak digital in hope that you "get what you pay for," but this was a disappointing experience from a company I trusted.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it!
Reviews.Author: K. Noulin
Reviews.Content: The HD video quality on this camera is superb, but that is probably the only thing going for it. Still images often turn out warped, and it has trouble taking pictures in either dim lighting or when it's bright outside. In other words the indoor pictures will often turn out blurry or the photos outside in bright sunlight look like the camera has been pointed directly into the sun. The battery life on the camera is average, but it's major drawback is the construction quality. The camera is very cheaply made and 'feels' very cheap when you hold it. It doesn't have anywhere near the durability of other manufacturer's cameras within the same price range. I treated my camera very well, yet it stopped working only after about 15 months. I turned it on one day, the lens extended out, something internally snapped, and the lens would no longer go back in. And then it wouldn't turn on altogether. I had never dropped nor damaged the camera, yet some internal mechanisms within the camera broke regardless from gentle and normal use. The camera is also a bit bulky when compared to similar makes. The camera also seems to have problems reading memory cards. Mine wouldn't distinguish between a 2GB memory card, or an 8GB memory card. If you put in a larger capacity memory card in order to record more video for example, the camera would only recognize the recording time as being that of a 2GB card instead. In other words it wouldn't record any more than the alloted time before it thought the memory card was full, which of course it wasn't. Finally, the battery will only charge when the camera is plugged into a USB port. The battery doesn't come with a separate charger. This can become a huge problem should you forget to plug your camera into the computer. Thus you'll likely need to order yourself an extra battery with a wall charger like I did so you can be sure the battery won't die while you're out and about. In conclusion, I wouldn't recommend this camera. Unless someone is selling a new one for a huge discount, say 50% off, I would shop around for a non-Kodak digital camera instead......

Reviews.Title: kodak M381  good compact camera
Reviews.Author: etienned "etienned"
Reviews.Content: Pretty good camera considering its size.  Has the largest screen presently available.Easy and simple to operate and to program.

Reviews.Title: Find Another Camera
Reviews.Author: Dale Farris "Camera Kid"
Reviews.Content: I biggest problem I had with this camera was the blur in half the pictures that I took, whether I was inside or outside.  When the picture came out nice, I was happy with the quality.  But over half of them didn't, and for the time that I've had this camera and the pictures that I took of my kids, most of the pictures are garbage and worthless.  I sold a perfectly working Canon to get this camera.  I have now returned the camera due to Beach Camera Nice Return Policy and have chosen to pay a little bit more and keep the better camera.  Another issue was that the Date Stamp feature that Kodak uses only works on an individual basis.  You have to Date Stamp each picture, instead of it automatically doing it for you.  The last thing I noticed was when I put the pictures on my computer, my program won't allow me to remove the red eye from the photos.  Kodak may be a name brand, but STAY AWAY FROM THIS CAMERA.  I warned you.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Mark Maize
Reviews.Content: I had a camera just like this but it broke. Price was right and made my day to have charger and batteries included. Thanks

Reviews.Title: Major Disappointment
Reviews.Author: M. Salfai
Reviews.Content: My wife bought me one of these for Christmas several years ago.  It was intended to replace a cheap digital. All I can say is that this camera was a major disappointment from day one.  Most photos come out blurry and totally un-useable.  They look great in the 3" LCD but when you download them they look terrible.  There seems to be no rhyme or reason to it as one photo out of ten or so will come out sharp, crisp, and clear while the rest will be out of focus and fuzzy - all without changing the setting. Don't waste your money on this camera.

Reviews.Title: Camera for Wife.
Reviews.Author: Edward L. Bartlett
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife, she doesn't like to use my Kodak Z712, she thinks it is to bulky. She loves this little camera.Ed Bartlett

Reviews.Title: Not too bad for the price
Reviews.Author: V. Orlov
Reviews.Content: Just found a local store selling this camera for $50. This is a great camera for the price. I took some indoor shots and found it to be somewhat acceptable. Obviously this is not an SLR or even an expensive point and shoot camera. So, do not expect it to take amazing pictures. At the same time, I am happy with quality and will keep this as backup point-and-shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Does not live up to expectation
Reviews.Author: MamaThree
Reviews.Content: I have been a long time Kodak customer so when my old easyshare had seen its day it was time toupgrade a bit. I had problems right off the bat with this camera. It does not take clear pictures.At first I thought it was me, then upon reading reviews I noticed that we all have very similar complaints, which points to a product defect. It is also nearly impossible to take clear photos when you turn the flash off. There are times you have to have the flash off or your subject will appear too washed out, but again if you turn it off you'll have a blurry photo. It's a no win situation. I have had cameras that cost 1/3 of this price that took photos 100% more clear! Don't waste your hard earned money on this piece of junk. I am really surprised at the poor quality.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful!
Reviews.Author: cmrohl
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures, so many settings, and choices, but also has a smart capture that takes great pictures regardless.

Reviews.Title: The pictures taken indoor were very dull.
Reviews.Author: Neeraj Mehta
Reviews.Content: I had another camera w290 and on comparing the pictures taken from both the cameras I found the Kodak pictures very dull so I have retured this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: K. Dazey "Kryten"
Reviews.Content: This camera was bought to replace a 3.1 megapixel Kodak, which still has no issues after five years and lots of abuse.  It did have limitations though.  12 megapixels is probably a bit more than I need, but the price was right.  I've been using the 4:3 aspect ratio at 6.2 megapixels most often to keep file size down.  I have no complaints so far, lots of great pictures indoor and out.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare M381
Reviews.Author: Susan L.
Reviews.Content: Wish That I would have realized that there was not a view finder on this camera. Very difficult to take pics when it is sunny. Takes awesome photos and has some excellent features.

Reviews.Title: Interesting Title
Reviews.Author: C. Brown
Reviews.Content: Not really much to say.Without breaking it down for eight hours, it is a good pocked camera.Though I did lose mine, I will be buying another as soon as I get a few extra dollars.

Reviews.Title: I might take this camera back
Reviews.Author: Mom of one
Reviews.Content: Kodak Easyshare M381 12.4MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and 3-inch LCD (Black)Kodak Easyshare M381 12.4MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and 3-inch LCD (Grey/Blue)Kodak Easyshare M381 12.4MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and 3-inch LCD (Grey/Blue)This camera is small and lightweight.  It is very simple to use and does not not take long to change the settings.**The camera is noisy.  It makes noise as it is trying to focus.  I have "muted" and turned "off"  all of the sound options and it is still noisy.I bought this camera on Black Friday - so I could not beat the price.  However, I may be taking it back to the store.

ProductInfo.Features:
12.4-megapixel resolution
5x optical zoom
Smart Capture feature automatically identifies the scene and adjusts camera settings
3-inch LCD screen
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak Easyshare M381 12.4MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and 3-inch LCD (Red)
